info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:53AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Columbia, northeastern Albany, south central Saratoga and Rensselaer Counties through 230 AM EDT... At 153 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Clifton Park to Menands to Selkirk. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albany, Troy, Clifton Park, East Greenbush, Cohoes, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Colonie, Nassau, Delmar, Latham, Menands, Stephentown, Green Island, New Lebanon, Grafton, Waterford, Berlin, Castleton-On-Hudson and Loudonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 24. Interstate 87 between exits 21A and 7, and between exits 8A and 9. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
